I often say, “A strong mind is the only true limitation—everything else is an illusion waiting to be shattered.” Many people are held back not by their physical condition, but by the stories they tell themselves about it. If someone is born with a disability, society often gives them a narrative of limitation. But I say, no—your body may have constraints, but your spirit has none.

Individual success is the result of relentless self-mastery. When you choose to push past perceived boundaries, when you refuse to accept the label of “disabled” as a permanent identity, you unlock a power within that transcends the physical. It’s not about denying your condition—it’s about refusing to let it define you.

Now, some might argue that certain physical conditions make the journey harder. I acknowledge that. But I also say this: difficulty is not the enemy. Struggle is the forge in which greatness is built. The person who has overcome physical adversity through sheer determination is not just successful—they are extraordinary. They have proven that the human will can rewrite destiny.

So, in my teachings, the physically able may have a head start, but it's not the finish line. What matters is how you use what you have. Are you using your body? Or are you using your will?

Let me ask you this: What do you believe is the one thing that cannot be taken from you? Your legs? Your eyesight? No. It’s your ability to decide who you are, and to rise, no matter the condition of your body.

Because in the end, success is not about how you were born—it’s about how you choose to live.
